theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on finite replicative capacity of cells, growth crisis, and correlation with species longevity, classic replicative senescence mechanisms.
Describes finite replicative capacity, intranuclear chronometer, and dominance of senescence over immortality, linking cellular senescence to organismal aging.
Details replicative senescence of fibroblasts, molecular mechanisms of senescence, and correlation with organismal aging.
Focuses on replicative senescence, accumulation of senescent cells in vivo, tumor suppression, and genetic control of lifespan.
Describes accumulation of senescent cells in mitotic tissues, telomere dysfunction-induced senescence, stress-induced senescence, and SASP.
High NaCl induces DNA damage and oxidative stress leading to cellular senescence and accelerated aging, fitting stress-induced senescence within replicative senescence context.
Focuses on metabolic reprogramming in senescent cells, especially mevalonate pathway downregulation and lipid metabolism decline driving senescence.
Senescent glia link mitochondrial dysfunction and lipid accumulation, highlighting metabolic dysfunction as a driver of senescence.
Describes metabolic activity of senescent cells, SASP, and role in metabolic diseases, emphasizing metabolic dysregulation in senescence.
Senescent cells produce increased ROS due to mitochondrial dysfunction, linking metabolic dysfunction and oxidative stress to senescence.
CK2 downregulation increases ROS and modulates IIS pathway, linking metabolic signaling and oxidative stress to senescence and aging.
ROS-induced cellular senescence theory emphasizing oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction as drivers of senescence and aging.
Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells, SASP, and senolytics/senomorphics targeting SASP to delay aging.
Describes senescence as causal driver of aging via SASP, and caloric restriction reducing senescent cell burden and SASP.
Details replicative senescence, SASP, developmental senescence, and tumor suppression roles of senescence.
Emphasizes senescence as causal driver of aging, SASP secretion, accumulation with age, and immune clearance mechanisms.
Focuses on MTOR regulation of SASP, IL1A translation, and rapamycin suppression of SASP to reduce inflammation and tumorigenesis.
Describes permanent growth arrest, antagonistic pleiotropy, and SASP as drivers of aging and inflammation.
Describes autophagy decline with age, its role in removing damaged organelles, and caloric restriction activating autophagy to delay aging.
Focuses on autophagy maintaining homeostasis, age-related decline, and lifespan extension by autophagy induction.
Details autophagy as cell maintenance, decline with age, oxidative damage, and pharmacological intensification as anti-aging.
Describes macroautophagy decline with age, regulation by nutrients and hormones, and enhancement by caloric restriction.
Focuses on autophagy decline in neurons causing mitochondrial and protein aggregate accumulation, synaptic abnormalities, and aging.
Describes autophagy decline with age, its role in liver aging and diseases, and autophagy as a longevity mechanism.
Focuses on mitophagy decline, accumulation of damaged mitochondria, oxidative stress, and caloric restriction maintaining autophagy.
Describes microglial senescence, immune exhaustion, low-grade neuroinflammation, and contribution to brain aging and neurodegeneration.
Focuses on neuronal p53 activity modulation extending lifespan, stress resistance, and overlap with calorie restriction pathways.
Describes complex dual role of p53 in aging, interaction with insulin/IGF-1 and TOR pathways, stem cell regulation, and ROS modulation.
